newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil soybean crop 21 pct harvested - Safras.
newsitem.headline: Brazil soybean crop 21 pct harvested - Safras.

text.p: Around 21 percent of Brazil's expected soybean crop had been harvested by March 13, consultants Safras e Mercado said in a weekly report.
The 21 percent compares with 13 percent by March 14, 1996, and an historical average over the past five years of 11 percent, it added.
In the week ending March 13, weather conditions helped contribute to the strong advance in harvesting throughout practically the whole country.
Output to-date still suggests overall production will be around 26.9 million tonnes.

Mainly dry weather in the center-south region is leading to some concern over a need for rains at least in the short-term to maintain moisture levels in states such as Rio Grande do Sul, Minas Gerais and the north of Mato Grosso do Sul where the crops will only be collected in April.
There are some outbreaks of fungus because of the high humidity during January and February but for the time being these are under control, Safras said.
A breakdown of percentage harvested by state follows.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
